sentences.en: But he regretted the pleasantry; it was too near a satire.
sentences.cn: 后来一想, 这句笑话太象当面挖苦了,他又后悔起来.

sentences.en: Great satire needs the sustenance of great fable.
sentences.cn: 伟大的讽刺作品需要伟大的怪异故事来滋养它.

sentences.en: He always saw the joke of any satire against himself.
sentences.cn: 任何对他的嘲笑,他都觉得挺有趣.

sentences.en: His descriptions of Gatsby's extravagant parties are closer to satire than eulogy.
sentences.cn: 他对盖茨比豪华宴会的描述与其说是称赞不如说是讽刺.

sentences.en: His poems participate of the nature of satire.
It's a satire somewhat in the manner of Dickens.
sentences.cn: 这部讽刺作品有点狄更斯的风格。

sentences.en: Jack showed his dislike plainly in scorching satire.
sentences.cn: 杰克以尖刻的讽刺直率地表明了自己的厌恶.

sentences.en: Satire is a lonely and introspective occupation.
sentences.cn: 讽刺是一项孤独而又内省的工作。

sentences.en: Sunset Boulevard was originally conceived by Wilder as an astringent satire on Hollywood.
sentences.cn: 怀尔德最初是想把《日落大道》拍成一部对好莱坞的辛辣讽刺片。

sentences.en: That book is a satire on the administration of justice.
sentences.cn: 那部作品是对司法工作的讽刺.

sentences.en: the characteristic use of satire in Jonson’s work
sentences.cn: 琼森作品中讽刺手法的独到运用

sentences.en: The commercial side of the Christmas season is an easy target for satire.
sentences.cn: 圣诞季商业化的一面很容易招来讥讽。

sentences.en: The film tries to be all things to all men— comedy, romance, fantasy, and satire.
sentences.cn: 这部电影试图面面俱到——既是喜剧、爱情剧、梦幻剧，还想是讽刺剧。

sentences.en: The movie is a clever satire on the advertising industry.
sentences.cn: 那部影片是关于广告业的一部巧妙的讽刺作品.

sentences.en: They shift vagariously from farce to satire, and even to mawkishness.
sentences.cn: 它们经常变化,由滑稽转为讽刺, 甚至转为感伤.

sentences.en: This brilliant, caustic, rambling satire is written in a colloquial style.
sentences.cn: 这篇光辉的, 刻薄的, 但很松散的讽刺叙事诗是以一种通俗的口语体写的.

words.tran_cn: 讽刺性的；讥讽的；爱挖苦人的

trans.tran_cn: 讽刺，讽刺文学，讽刺作品
trans.tran_en: a way of criticizing something such as a group of people or a system, in which you deliberately make them seem funny so that people will see their faults
